reporting-org.narrative: UTZ - joined forces with Rainforest Alliance

title.narrative: Building capacities for sector change: Country Program Cote d´Ivoire

description.narrative: In 2020 we will have strengthened the lobby and advocacy capacity of civil society organizations in Cote d´Ivoire on productivity, farmer group strengthening, climate and water and child labor. As a result we will see an improvement of policy environment (both government and companies) and support services in these countries related to these themes. These themes are: 1. Sustainable productivity Raising smallholder productivity in a sustainable way is a key component of sector transformation. It is needed to increase income of the farmer and increase production while lowering the environmental footprint. 2. Smallholder inclusion & farmer group strengthening The aim is to increase the inclusion of smallholders in supply-chain driven sustainability programs. Strengthening farmer organizations is seen as an important way to increase the bargaining power of smallholder farmers in the supply chain. 3. Women’s empowerment and gender The goal is to increase the inclusion of women in certification and access to benefits as well as to reduce discrimination and violence against women. 4. Climate and water The focus is on up scaling of best practices in smallholder adaptation to climate change and sustainable water use. 5. Child labor The focus is on prevention, monitoring and remediation of child labor.
SP-CDI Building capacities for sector change: Country Program Cote d´Ivoire

title.narrative: Country Scan

description.narrative: During the first part of the inception phase of the program (December 2015-March 2016) UTZ Country Representatives / SP focal points, supported by external consultants and UTZ Amsterdam staff, carried out a deeper analysis of the sector(s) and themes proposed for their countries to develop a more focused approach for the SP program. The objective of the Country Scans was “to provide a situational analysis on each sector and theme per country assessing the current state with regards to the relevant thematic SP objectives, clearly formulating the causes of the problem that need addressing and identify opportunities for interventions and provide recommendations on potential partners for these interventions.” The Country Scan documents are based on our own experience in the countries, but also document review, conversations/interviews with experts, key informants including Dutch embassy staff, national and international organizations, and workshop results with many of these actors.

title.narrative: # of country scans

comment.narrative: 1 country scan is completed for Cote d´Ivoire
10-01-2018: 1 country scan completed for Cote d´Ivoire

title.narrative: Country Plan

description.narrative: During the second part of the inception phase of the program (April-July 2016) UTZ Country Representatives / SP focal points, supported by external consultants and UTZ Amsterdam staff in drafting the country plans. The purpose of the SP country program plan is to set out a strategic direction for sector change in the country and serves as a framework. This plan clearly states UTZ goals for the country the Theory of Change to guide interventions as well as the budget for said activities. Overall, the SP Country Plan will serve as a guide for the next years, as well as a basis for the year plans that will be formulated for 2017 to 2020.

title.narrative: # of country plans

comment.narrative: 1 country plan is completed for Cote d´Ivoire
10-01-2018: 1 country plan completed for Cote d´Ivoire

title.narrative: Ultimate Outcome 2: Policy changes & implementation

description.narrative: Policies are better in line with the needs of female and male farmers, smallholders and workers; Adequate implementation of policies;

title.narrative: DD1 # of ((inter)national) standards and policies implemented

description.narrative: Adequate implementation of policies

comment.narrative: 29-04-2020: 1) child labor: Target communities in Soubré, Abengourou, and Meagui have setup surveillance/watchdog committees for effective monitoring of the child protection activities by the communities. Social workers (centers) are better coordinating and structuring the fight against child labor in the communities.

29-04-2021: 1.The Royalty of Abengourou is committed to supporting the actions of village chiefs in the fight against child labor. 2. The Collective of Cooperative Societies is committed to financially supporting the protection of children. 3. Cocoa Communities in Abengourou and soubré have budgeted a local strategy for enforcing child labor laws. 4. CPE- A mechanism for monitoring the carrying of loads by children has been put in place and consists of requisitioning the heavy luggage carried by children (4 to 5 cases per day) and then summoning parents to the village chief's home (President of the CPE) in order to sensitize them to the risks of carrying heavy loads by children. 5. Parents/community members (at the instigation of the CPEs) declared 13 children in the registers for substitute judgments and 37 were enrolled in formal school. 6. Actors of the cocoa industry / coalition implemented a tree registration process 7. Trainers associated with RA and companies use material on climate change in their training courses.

title.narrative: DD2 # of policy changes that UTZ /partners contributed to

description.narrative: Policies are better in line with the needs of (female) smallholders, (female) farmers and (female) farm workers, based on their needs and interests

comment.narrative: 29-04-2019: IMPACTUM: New forestry policy (preservation, rehabilitation, expansion) was adopted

29-04-2020: 1) Government, Communities, Cooperatives have enhanced coordination and structuring of fight against child labor in the community, and assigned a Focal person (agent) dedicated to child protection to each cooperative 2) Coffee & Cocoa Board (CCC)adherce to the new cooperatives capacity strengthening approach on gender and financial management

29-04-2021: 1. The active participation of women in decision-making and monitoring of community initiatives 2. Within the CPE, a women's sub-committee has been set up to develop and implement an informal plan to facilitate the resolution of domestic conflicts and prevent child abuse.

title.narrative: Ultimate Outcome 3: Improvement of services

description.narrative: Services are better in line with the needs of female and male farmers, smallholders and workers; increased funding for services

title.narrative: DD1 # of new or improved government/company programs & services with budget allocation that are targeted and tailored to the needs of female and male smallholders and workers (related to the theme)

description.narrative: Services are better in line with the needs of (female) smallholders, (female) farmers and (female) farm workers, based on their needs and interests; increased funding for services

comment.narrative: 29-04-2020: Cocoa Cooperatives (including women and youth) in San-Pédro, Soubré, Abengourou are implementing more gender-sensitive curriculum, tailored to the needs of cooperative actors (leaders, women, youth) and gender mainstreaming in strategic decision-making and cooperative projects

29-04-2021: 1 communities in Kouaméagui and Sakiaré have a school construction project underway and development of educational structures driven by the recognition and integration of the need for children to go to school (school construction registration in their PAC) 2. The accountant and the cashier recruited at SOCOSADA are able to make forecasts for a better management of the cooperative. 3. Integration of new gender-sensitive tools and good financial practices endorsed by the Cocoa Coffee Council at all selected cooperatives in Affery, Agboville, Songan, Appouesso.
Target value for this period has not been defined yet.

title.narrative: Baseline Report

description.narrative: The baseline provides an elaborate context-analysis per country, containing details about capacity of partners and the current state regarding the thematic goals for L&A. The baseline focuses on three main areas: a. Description of baseline situation of context and stakeholders b. Baseline of outcomes of ToC c. Capacities assessment

As a speaker on cocoa on the agricultural fair organized by the ducht embassy. 5. title.narrative: # and type of structural collaborations with gov., private sector, other standards, CSOs etc.

comment.narrative: N/A

29-04-2019: 1: We have a good collaboration with IDH on landscape management. 2: We have developed a letter of intent with the National Overseeing committee for child rights (led by the First Lady) 3: Structural meetings with the Dutch embassy We invite them e.g to our ToC workshops and they invite us when they are having meetings/ fairs on agriculture. In our initial meeting we presented the whole SP program to them, now we meet on a regular basis and discuss topics like tree ownership and gender.
